history.text: Hi, there! Have you seen "The Post"?
No, I have not.
Have you seen it?
I haven't either, but it looks to be a good movie. It stars Merrell Streep and Tom hanks. I think both of them are really good! How about you?
It's a Stephen movie, his movies are usually good.
True. I love movies about newspaper stuff, too. Do you?
Yes, it looks like a good story and is fact based.
Even rotton tomatoes liked it!
I like Sarah Paulson as well.
You know, I don't know her by name!
She's a good actress.
it gets high marks among all the critics.
It's interesting how most people probably supported how Ellsberg copied the classified documents and those same people today -- much older -- are probably opposed to Wikileaks!
It's set in the early 1970's, so it should be interesting to go back to that time.
I agree. Back when newspapers, like WAshPost & NYTimes, was newspapers!
Publishing classified documents, it has significance for present day.

I agree! My sister was around then and thought it was great, but she really hates Solange, the Wikileaks guy. I wonder what she sees as the difference? I think people just get older and more conservative.
That Nixon! He was after everyone who dissented, wasn't he?
Yea, Nixon was something.
Something else! ha ha!
I didn't realize the newspaper was a Graham family business.
I didn't either, although that's one of the good things about this film, we'll learn things we didn't know.
I agree! I really like that!
I'm glad she decided to run the story and set the precedent of publishing difficult material
I didn't know the US was involved in the Vietnam for 30 years.
I'm glad she did as well.
Ha ha! Well, there's the pot calling the kettle black - 1 year later is watergate!
Yep and we know what happens after that.
Indeed. Checkers and his family move out of the white house. I'm surprised 3 justices vote against the newspaper!
That is surprising.
It's also surprising the White House can bar reputable papers.
Isn't it, why would the law allow that in a democracy?
Maybe the White House is above the law... considering the subject matter of the movie itself!!
It certainly seems that way.
Do you plan to watch the movie?
I see they compare this movie to All The President's Men, have you ever seen that?
Yes, I have. It's great!!
Yes,I plan to watch it.
It reminds me a bit of Spotlight, too, where they ran the story on the abuse by the Catholic priests. I'm going to look up The Post, too!
I've enjoyed talking to you today! Have a great rest of your day!
Spotlight is an excellent film,  I enjoyed talking to you as well, have a good day.

uid1response.feedback: I think I will look this movie up! Thanks!
